title: Item Group
text: You can sell products that aren't set up in the system or don't require stock tracking using the "Item Group" button during transactions. This feature lets you sell an item without specifying its details, which is handy for low-value items you want to clear or those without barcodes. Item Group sales allow you to track and analyze sales at a higher level, rather than individual items. The available Item Groups at the point of sale (PoS) come from the Item Hierarchy structure. Each Item Group has a tax code for accurate tax collection. However, to see an Item Group at the PoS, the store must be linked to the same Tax Group Code as the Item Hierarchy, and the store must have the Item Hierarchy selected. The following explains the process in detail. To select where the Item Group should appear on the Point of Sale (POS), go to the Back Office and click on "Shops" from the options list. Choose the appropriate location and take note of the Primary Group and Tax Group information to ensure correct display on the POS. To view tax rates for a specific Item Hierarchy, go to "Inventory" in the menu and select "Item Hierarchies". Choose the desired Node and click on the edit icon to see the assigned tax rates and make adjustments if needed. If adjustments are necessary, refer to the "Create Hierarchies Root Node" section for guidance. Note: You can only select one tax code per tax group. To set up Item Hierarchies for your groups, navigate to "Groups" in the Back Office. Create a new group (and set it as the Primary Group for your shop) or edit an existing group. Ensure that the Item Hierarchy list on the Group Details page includes the desired hierarchy for display on the Point of Sale (PoS). Save any changes made. When launching your shop's PoS, the "Item Groups" button will show the groups set up in the previous step. Click on the "Item Groups" button from the menu to access it. The configured Item Groups can be viewed in the centre panel using this feature. To sell items under a specific Item Group, simply click on it and enter the desired selling price when prompted. If you have multiple Item Groups, use the filter buttons at the bottom to refine your list. Clicking on a filter button will display the filter, and you can further narrow down the list using the search box. Additionally, the "Sort By" option allows you to arrange your Item Groups by ID number or Name. The Reset button will clear any applied filters. The cancel button will return you to the Transaction screen.
description:
You can sell products that aren't set up in the system or don't require stock tracking using the "Item Group" button during transactions. This feature lets you sell an item without specifying its details, which is handy for low-value items you want to clear or those without barcodes.


Item Group sales allow you to track and analyze sales at a higher level, rather than individual items. The available Item Groups at the point of sale (PoS) come from the Item Hierarchy structure.


Each Item Group has a tax code for accurate tax collection. However, to see an Item Group at the PoS, the store must be linked to the same Tax Group Code as the Item Hierarchy, and the store must have the Item Hierarchy selected.


The following explains the process in detail.

To select where the Item Group should appear on the Point of Sale (POS), go to the Back Office and click on "Shops" from the options list.


Choose the appropriate location and take note of the Primary Group and Tax Group information to ensure correct display on the POS.



To view tax rates for a specific Item Hierarchy, go to "Inventory" in the menu and select "Item Hierarchies".

Choose the desired Node and click on the edit icon to see the assigned tax rates and make adjustments if needed.

If adjustments are necessary, refer to the "Create Hierarchies Root Node" section for guidance.

Note: You can only select one tax code per tax group.



To set up Item Hierarchies for your groups, navigate to "Groups" in the Back Office.

Create a new group (and set it as the Primary Group for your shop) or edit an existing group.

Ensure that the Item Hierarchy list on the Group Details page includes the desired hierarchy for display on the Point of Sale (PoS). Save any changes made.



When launching your shop's PoS, the "Item Groups" button will show the groups set up in the previous step. Click on the "Item Groups" button from the menu to access it.


The configured Item Groups can be viewed in the centre panel using this feature.



To sell items under a specific Item Group, simply click on it and enter the desired selling price when prompted.



If you have multiple Item Groups, use the filter buttons at the bottom to refine your list. Clicking on a filter button will display the filter, and you can further narrow down the list using the search box.

Additionally, the "Sort By" option allows you to arrange your Item Groups by ID number or Name.




The Reset button will clear any applied filters.

The cancel button will return you to the Transaction screen.

title: Item Shortcuts
text: An Item can be selected to be shown as a Hotkey under the right hand Item Shortcuts button. Item Shortcuts are managed @Here in Item Hierarchy. Select Item Shortcuts from the right hand menu. Item Shortcuts are displayed in the POS by folder levels. Click on the folder to display the items. Find and click on the item you require this will add the item to the transaction. By selecting cancel you will be taken back to the Receipt View.
description:
An Item can be selected to be shown as a Hotkey under the right hand Item Shortcuts button.


Item Shortcuts are managed @Here in Item Hierarchy.


Select Item Shortcuts from the right hand menu.



Item Shortcuts are displayed in the POS by folder levels.


Click on the folder to display the items.


Find and click on the item you require this will add the item to the transaction.



By selecting cancel you will be taken back to the Receipt View.

title: Gift Certificate
text: You can sell/issue a Gift Certificate via the PoS which can then be redeemed as a tender in any of your shops. Note: It is not possible to apply a discount to a Gift Certificate at the PoS, irrespective of the settings in the Miscellaneous Tab. Gift Certificates are multi-currency. They are generated based on the stores base currency and you can redeem the voucher in any store that supports that currency. If a store does not support that currency it will report the certificate number as not found. Tap the Create Gift Certificate button to create one. The soft keyboard will appear Key in the value of the Gift Certificate to confirm press enter on the keyboard or the soft keyboard. Note: The screen will show the created Gift Certificate and the generated number. This number is a combination of the Store, POS and Transaction Numbers. You can perform other functions on the Gift Certificate whilst it is in the basket. You can Discount using the standard methods including Line Price - but please note this does not affect the value of the gift certificate - only the price paid for it. You can add as many gift certificates to the transaction as required When you pay for your transaction, you will receive an individual slip of paper representing each Gift Certificate from the receipt printer. Email Gift Receipt If the customer asks for the Gift Receipt to be emailed to them this can be done at the end of the transaction. Note: This has to be activated via the portal in POS Admin > POS Options. Once the customer has paid for their Gift Receipt select Enter the customer's email address or the address given and press A notification of the email success will appear in the top right.
description:
You can sell/issue a Gift Certificate via the PoS which can then be redeemed as a tender in any of your shops.


Note: It is not possible to apply a discount to a Gift Certificate at the PoS, irrespective of the settings in the Miscellaneous Tab.


Gift Certificates are multi-currency. They are generated based on the stores base currency and you can redeem the voucher in any store that supports that currency. If a store does not support that currency it will report the certificate number as not found.


Tap the Create Gift Certificate button to create one.
 


The soft keyboard will appear Key in the value of the Gift Certificate to confirm press enter on the keyboard or the soft keyboard.


Note: The screen will show the created Gift Certificate and the generated number. This number is a combination of the Store, POS and Transaction Numbers.



You can perform other functions on the Gift Certificate whilst it is in the basket.



You can Discount using the standard methods including Line Price - but please note this does not affect the value of the gift certificate - only the price paid for it.


You can add as many gift certificates to the transaction as required


When you pay for your transaction, you will receive an individual slip of paper representing each Gift Certificate from the receipt printer.

Email Gift Receipt

If the customer asks for the Gift Receipt to be emailed to them this can be done at the end of the transaction. 


Note: This has to be activated via the portal in POS Admin > POS Options. 



Once the customer has paid for their Gift Receipt select 




Enter the customer's email address or the address given and press
A notification of the email success will appear in the top right.

title: Sell Set
text: NOTE: The Sell Set feature is intended to be deprecated after April 2023. You should consider using PPE Promotions instead. Sell Set allows you to sell a selection of items together for a fixed price. For example, you may sell a Shirt, a Tie and a pair of cufflinks and give them to the customer for €100. Press the Sell Set button on the menu to include items into a set. The transaction screen changes to show you this. Anything you scan or search for will be bundled together into the "Set" except for any items marked as “POS Block Discount” or Item Group. Neither of these types of items can be added to a Sell Set. Items will be added as individual lines and not aggregated. This is similar to the option POS Block Quantity Entry. It is possible to add a Prompt For Price item to a Sell Set but such items are given the price you enter. Any discount available from the Sell Set promotion is apportioned across the other items in the Sell Set. At least two or more items must be included in your set. When you have included everything you want in your set click the OK button or tap the Enter Amount box to key in the price you want to sell the set for. It will pop open the Soft Keyboard for you to enter a value. Press the Green Tick to apply the total price for the Set. A set must have a value greater than 0 (zero) to be valid. Once the price is entered it cannot be altered. To change the price of a set you should delete the set and start again Tap the Enter Amount box to key in the price you want to sell the set for. It will pop open the Soft Keyboard for you to enter a value. press the Green Tick to apply the price. NOTE: There are set denominations for quick use. The transaction then gets the discount split across the transaction lines and quantities. When an item is part of a set you cannot make changes to individual components of that set. Selecting one of the items will allow you to either Delete the whole set, set the item as a Gift or change the Clerk. NOTE: Pressing the Delete option on any set item will remove the entire set. To make changes to a set once the price has been applied will require you to delete the set and start again. You can continue adding additional items to the basket and make your payment when ready as per any other transaction.
description:
NOTE: The Sell Set feature is intended to be deprecated after April 2023. You should consider using PPE Promotions instead.


Sell Set allows you to sell a selection of items together for a fixed price. For example, you may sell a Shirt, a Tie and a pair of cufflinks and give them to the customer for €100.


Press the Sell Set button on the menu to include items into a set.


The transaction screen changes to show you this.



Anything you scan or search for will be bundled together into the "Set" except for any items marked as “POS Block Discount” or Item Group. Neither of these types of items can be added to a Sell Set.


Items will be added as individual lines and not aggregated. This is similar to the option POS Block Quantity Entry.

It is possible to add a Prompt For Price item to a Sell Set but such items are given the price you enter.


 Any discount available from the Sell Set promotion is apportioned across the other items in the Sell Set.

At least two or more items must be included in your set.



When you have included everything you want in your set click the OK button or tap the Enter Amount box to key in the price you want to sell the set for. It will pop open the Soft Keyboard for you to enter a value. Press the Green Tick to apply the total price for the Set.

A set must have a value greater than 0 (zero) to be valid. Once the price is entered it cannot be altered. To change the price of a set you should delete the set and start again


Tap the Enter Amount box to key in the price you want to sell the set for. It will pop open the Soft Keyboard for you to enter a value. press the Green Tick to apply the price.


NOTE: There are set denominations for quick use.



The transaction then gets the discount split across the transaction lines and quantities.



When an item is part of a set you cannot make changes to individual components of that set. 

Selecting one of the items will allow you to either Delete the whole set, set the item as a Gift or change the Clerk.

NOTE: Pressing the Delete option on any set item will remove the entire set. To make changes to a set once the price has been applied will require you to delete the set and start again.



You can continue adding additional items to the basket and make your payment when ready as per any other transaction.

title: Make Expenses
text: Making an Expense is a way to charge expenses to the till. For example, for cleaning, staff welfare etc. These are configured in the back office/Expenses To make an expense in the POS press the Make Expense button. Choose the item group you want to associate the expense to. You will then be asked to key in the expense amount using the Soft Keyboard. It will then add a line to the POS basket. Here you can change the Line Clerk, Delete the Line or add a Comment to the expense. Adding a comment is recommended. An expense transaction can only be completed against the Cash payment type. You can then complete the transaction and issue the money. A receipt will be printed to track this.
description:
Making an Expense is a way to charge expenses to the till. For example, for cleaning, staff welfare etc.


These are configured in the back office/Expenses


To make an expense in the POS press the Make Expense button.

Choose the item group you want to associate the expense to.



You will then be asked to key in the expense amount using the Soft Keyboard.



It will then add a line to the POS basket. 



Here you can change the Line Clerk, Delete the Line or add a Comment to the expense. Adding a comment is recommended.

An expense transaction can only be completed against the Cash payment type.

You can then complete the transaction and issue the money. A receipt will be printed to track this.

title: Parked Transactions
text: The Park transactions feature is designed for when you want to suspend a transaction in its full state without losing it. There are several reasons for this. such as the customer forgetting their wallet and will come back later, or where the POS device is shared between Clerks. To park a transaction you must have an item(s) or a customer assigned to the transaction. Click the Park Transaction button, this will revert the POS to the login page. NOTE: A new transaction can be started, completed and even many more after that. The parked notes are safely held for recall at a later stage. When you have logged back into the POS click the Parked Transactions in the left-hand menu. This will list all Parked transactions you have in your Store. It will show you the Date, Time, Value and Clerk Number. You can also tap it to expand it and see what is on the note. And from here you choose to Delete the parked transaction, or recall it back to the Basket to complete the transaction.
description:
The Park transactions feature is designed for when you want to suspend a transaction in its full state without losing it. There are several reasons for this. such as the customer forgetting their wallet and will come back later, or where the POS device is shared between Clerks. 


To park a transaction you must have an item(s) or a customer assigned to the transaction.




Click the Park Transaction button, this will revert the POS to the login page. 


NOTE: A new transaction can be started, completed and even many more after that. The parked notes are safely held for recall at a later stage.


When you have logged back into the POS click the Parked Transactions in the left-hand menu.


This will list all Parked transactions you have in your Store. It will show you the Date, Time, Value and Clerk Number. 



You can also tap it to expand it and see what is on the note.



And from here you choose to Delete the parked transaction, or recall it back to the Basket to complete the transaction.

title: Find Receipt
text: The Find Receipt button lets you search for previous transactions and either reprint or return them. The page will show the most recent transactions in a list. Click the required transaction and it will expand with options. You can choose to reprint, print a gift receipt (if set up in the back office E-Mail Receipt will show) or the option to return the item. You can locate a specific receipt by using the Toggle Filters which will display a pop-up. Search using a date filter range, as well as being able to search for all stores Choose a date range and enter a search string. You can search based on the following values: Clerk's name or number Customer Number Date Transaction Amount Payment Type Receipt Barcode Item Barcode Item No Item Comment Transaction Type (Sale, Return, Exchange) A list of receipts will be displayed, tap to expand the receipt you wish to view. If you cannot see your receipt then click Show More Results to bring back any further receipts (receipts are shown in batches of 100 at a time) You can then reprint the receipt, create a Return from it or print a Gift Receipt for the transaction. The Find Receipt also displays Cash Statements which you can view and reprint. Cancel will return you to the PoS transaction screen
description:
The Find Receipt button lets you search for previous transactions and either reprint or return them.

The page will show the most recent transactions in a list.



Click the required transaction and it will expand with options. 



You can choose to reprint, print a gift receipt (if set up in the back office E-Mail Receipt will show) or the option to return the item.


You can locate a specific receipt by using the Toggle Filters which will display a pop-up. Search using a date filter range, as well as being able to search for all stores



Choose a date range and enter a search string. You can search based on the following values:

  • Clerk's name or number
  • Customer Number
  • Date
  • Transaction Amount
  • Payment Type
  • Receipt Barcode
  • Item Barcode
  • Item No
  • Item Comment
  • Transaction Type (Sale, Return, Exchange)


A list of receipts will be displayed, tap to expand the receipt you wish to view. If you cannot see your receipt then click Show More Results to bring back any further receipts (receipts are shown in batches of 100 at a time)


You can then reprint the receipt, create a Return from it or print a Gift Receipt for the transaction.



The Find Receipt also displays Cash Statements which you can view and reprint.

Cancel will return you to the PoS transaction screen

title: Reprint Last Receipt
text: You can print a duplicate copy of the last receipt in two different ways. Clicking the Reprint Last within the right-hand menu. Or select the ellipses ... in the top right and select Print Last Receipt.
description:
You can print a duplicate copy of the last receipt in two different ways. 


Clicking the Reprint Last within the right-hand menu.

Or select the ellipses ... in the top right and select Print Last Receipt.

title: Void Transaction
text: To Void a transaction. Press the button and scan the receipt barcode to perform a reverse of the transaction.
description: To Void a transaction. Press the button and scan the receipt barcode to perform a reverse of the transaction.

title: Cancel Sale
text: The Cancel Sale button will abort the current transaction in any state and return you to the Login screen.
description: The Cancel Sale button will abort the current transaction in any state and return you to the Login screen.

title: Journals
text: The Journals feature allows you to reprint a batch of receipts, which could be useful when reconciling your till. It's accessed through the Ellipsis button. Then click the Journals button from the list. From the Journals page, you can choose which dates you require. You can either Print terminal journal, for EFT receipts, or Print receipt journal, for standard sales receipts. Click Cancel to return to the POS
description:
The Journals feature allows you to reprint a batch of receipts, which could be useful when reconciling your till.

It's accessed through the Ellipsis button. 

Then click the Journals button from the list.


From the Journals page, you can choose which dates you require.


You can either Print terminal journal, for EFT receipts, or Print receipt journal, for standard sales receipts. Click Cancel to return to the POS

title: Email Receipt
text: Email Receipt Functionality Imagine supports an Email Receipt feature that allows you to send a standardized email receipt upon the completion of a transaction. You can use the Email Receipt button to initiate this process. Please note that the format of the email receipt is fixed and cannot be customized. Using the Email Receipt Function To use the Email Receipt function, ensure that your Point of Sale (POS) system is online and has an active Internet connection. If your POS shows as offline or if there is no Internet connection, the Email Receipt function will not be available. Sending Email Receipts while Offline If you attempt to send an email receipt while offline, it will not be delivered. In such cases, it is recommended to provide a paper copy of the receipt instead. Failed Email Notifications In some cases, email notifications may fail to be delivered. If you encounter this issue, you can try adding the following IP address to your whitelist: 149.72.233.183. This might help in ensuring that the email notifications are successfully delivered. Note: Whitelisting the above IP address should only be done if you have confirmed that email notifications are failing to be delivered.
description:
Email Receipt Functionality

Imagine supports an Email Receipt feature that allows you to send a standardized email receipt upon the completion of a transaction. You can use the Email Receipt button to initiate this process. Please note that the format of the email receipt is fixed and cannot be customized.


Using the Email Receipt Function

To use the Email Receipt function, ensure that your Point of Sale (POS) system is online and has an active Internet connection. If your POS shows as offline or if there is no Internet connection, the Email Receipt function will not be available.


Sending Email Receipts while Offline

If you attempt to send an email receipt while offline, it will not be delivered. In such cases, it is recommended to provide a paper copy of the receipt instead.


Failed Email Notifications

In some cases, email notifications may fail to be delivered. If you encounter this issue, you can try adding the following IP address to your whitelist: 149.72.233.183. This might help in ensuring that the email notifications are successfully delivered.


Note: Whitelisting the above IP address should only be done if you have confirmed that email notifications are failing to be delivered.

title: Account Deposit
text: When a customer is attached to a transaction via the widget menu you can make deposits to their account. This can be if they owe you money, or perhaps they want to pre-load an account with money to be paid. The button appears only when a customer is attached to the transaction.
description:
When a customer is attached to a transaction via the widget menu you can make deposits to their account. 


This can be if they owe you money, or perhaps they want to pre-load an account with money to be paid.

The button appears only when a customer is attached to the transaction.

title: Picklist Report
text: The Pick List Report is used to print a list of the item(s) that have been sold in a user-determined period. This print will be to the receipt printer. Picklist Reports are generally used as a restocking list, the clerk may print this list, check the item(s) sold, see what is on the shelf/rail for that item(s) and replenish stock from the stock room if the shelf/rail is low. This function can be performed several times a day. Picklist Type - Select between Vendors- Hierarchy or Hierarchy - Vendors. Order By - Choose between Item No, Item Name, Item Description or Vendor Item No. Since the last print - Tick this box to print a list based on all sales since the last time you ran a Picklist Report. This can be useful if you don’t know the last time the report was run. Start Date - The first date you want the Picklist Report to include. End Date - The last date you want the Picklist Report to include. NOTE: ‘Since last print’ and ‘Start Date/End Date’ are exclusive, you can only choose one or the other, not both. Cancel - This will return you to the POS main transaction screen. The printed-out picklist will show. Shop name Start and End dates and times for the sales included in the report Date and time the Picklist Report was printed A list of items sold in the selected period with Sold showing how many were sold in this period Returned showing how many were returned in this period Net showing the result of Sold minus Returned The number On-Hand currently for this item Totals showing a sum of all Sold, Returned and the Net figure
description:
The Pick List Report is used to print a list of the item(s) that have been sold in a user-determined period. This print will be to the receipt printer.


Picklist Reports are generally used as a restocking list, the clerk may print this list, check the item(s) sold, see what is on the shelf/rail for that item(s) and replenish stock from the stock room if the shelf/rail is low. 



This function can be performed several times a day.



Picklist Type - Select between Vendors- Hierarchy or Hierarchy - Vendors.

Order By - Choose between Item No, Item Name, Item Description or Vendor Item No.

Since the last print -  Tick this box to print a list based on all sales since the last time you ran a Picklist Report. This can be useful if you don’t know the last time the report was run.

Start Date - The first date you want the Picklist Report to include.

End Date - The last date you want the Picklist Report to include.

NOTE: ‘Since last print’ and ‘Start Date/End Date’ are exclusive, you can only choose one or the other, not both.

Cancel -  This will return you to the POS main transaction screen.


The printed-out picklist will show.

  • Shop name
  • Start and End dates and times for the sales included in the report
  • Date and time the Picklist Report was printed
  • A list of items sold in the selected period with
    • Sold showing how many were sold in this period
    • Returned showing how many were returned in this period
    • Net showing the result of Sold minus Returned
    • The number On-Hand currently for this item
  • Totals showing a sum of all Sold, Returned and the Net figure
